name: .PRTDOT File Extension
summary: Learn about .PRTDOT files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A PRTDOT file is a part template created by Dassault Systemes SolidWorks, a commercial CAD program. It contains part document properties, and it may also include associated sketches, notes, and features. Engineers use PRTDOT files to apply property presets to new SolidWorks parts (.SLDPRT files).

content: Dassault Systemes SolidWorks is a program that engineers use to create 3D models of industrial parts, including sheet metal, piping and tubing, molds, and plastic and cast parts. Those 3D models are saved as SLDPRT files.

If an engineer knows they'll want to reuse the document properties associated with an existing part, they can save those properties as a PRTDOT file. They can then select the PRTDOT file during the part creation process, to apply the properties it contains to their new part.
To create a new SolidWorks part template:
Select File → New and create a new part.
Modify the part's document properties as needed.
In the Save as type: field, select Part Templates (*.prtdot).
Name and save your PRTDOT file
SolidWorks will then save your PRTDOT file in the program's default template folder.

instructions: You can open a PRTDOT file in Dassault Systemes SolidWorks (Windows, Mac). To do so:
When the New SolidWorks Document window appears, select the Templates tab.
Select and open your PRTDOT file.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
